IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To be the member's primary financial institution by providing and promoting a full-range of services in a convenient, courteous and professional manner.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To be the member's primary financial institution by providing and promoting a full-range of services in a convenient, courteous and professional manner.
IRS990.Desc: First Community provides loans to members at low rates while paying high dividends on depository accounts. We serve over 356 thousand members offering auto, home, business and unsecure loans. We also offer various depository options such as savings and checking accounts, certificates of deposit, money management accounts and IRA accounts.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: Senior Vice President of Branch Administration
Senior Vice President of Communications and Public Relations

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: As part of our normal first mortgage loan servicing, payments are collected monthly from the borrower and placed in escrow to pay their real estate taxes and homeowner's insurance. First Community pays the taxes and insurance premiums when due on behalf of the borrower.
First Community is exempt from income taxes under Section 501(c)(14) of the Internal Revenue Code.

RltdOrgOfficerTrstKeyEmplGrp.TitleTxt: Senior Vice President of Branch Administration
Senior Vice President of Communications and Public Relations

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The credit union provides travel for companions.
The President and Senior VP of Lending participate in these plans.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: David Hudson, is the son of Board member Sharon Hudson

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Sharon Hudson, Board Member, has a family relationship with David Hudson, Officer.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: First Community is a state-chartered, not-for-profit financial cooperative. Every member is both a member and an owner.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A meeting of members is called to fill vacancies on the Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: By a majority vote of those present at any meeting, the members may decide any matter of interest of the credit union, amend the bylaws relating to qualifications of membership, election or appointment of the supervisory committee, determine the requirements for a credit committee and if such committee should be elected or appointed, and overrule the directors on any matter concerning the guidelines for future plans and objectives, provided the notice of the meeting has stated any such matter to be considered upon a written request of any member, except that the members cannot cause the credit union to breach or abrogate any legal obligation or contract previously executed by the board.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form 990 was reviewed by the Senior Vice-President/CFO and was presented to the Board of Directors for their review at the October 2023 meeting.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Written Conflict of Interest Policy is maintained in the policy manual. The Compliance Officer and Internal Auditor monitor vendor and employee accounts for correlations.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: President's compensation is determined by review of compensation surveys and is recommended and approved by the Board of Directors. Officer's compensation is determined by use of compensation surveys and recommended and approved by the President.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Financial statements are posted at the branches on public display and are also available on the credit union's website homepage.
Other changes in net assets include changes in accounting for pension and post-retirement plans.
